## ğŸ“š Overview

This template library provides **structured documentation templates** for all CreativeWorkzStudio LLC work. These aren't simple fill-in-the-blank forms - they're **thinking tools** that guide you through Kingdom Technology principles while creating documentation.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> **Templates â‰  Fill-in-the-blanks.** These templates include embedded thinking guidance to help you apply Kingdom Technology standards intentionally, not mechanically.

### What This Template Library Provides

| Icon | Category | What You'll Find | Who It Serves |
|:----:|----------|------------------|---------------|
| ğŸ“„ | **General** | Universal templates for standards, guides, patterns | Anyone creating formal documentation |
| ğŸ“š | **INDEX** | Navigation structure templates | Those organizing multi-document projects |
| ğŸ’» | **Code** | Code file templates with 4-block structure | Developers writing Kingdom Technology code |
| ğŸ¯ | **Specialized** | Domain-specific templates (future) | Specialized documentation needs |

> [!NOTE]
> **Templates Serve Standards:** All templates enforce [4-block structure](../standards/CWS-STD-001-DOC-4-block.md), [document keying](../standards/CWS-STD-002-DOC-document-keying.md), and [documentation standards](../standards/CWS-STD-003-DOC-documentation-standards.md).

<details open>
<summary><h3>ğŸ“„ <a href="general/TEMPLATE-G-000-INDEX-general.md">General Templates</a> (TEMPLATE-G)</h3></summary>

**Universal documentation templates for standards, patterns, guides, and references**

| Key | Template | Status | Use For |
|-----|----------|:------:|---------|
| **[G-001](general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md)** | Standard Document | âœ… Active | Standards, patterns, guides, references, policies |

**Key features:**

- 4-block structure (METADATA â†’ SETUP â†’ BODY â†’ CLOSING)
- Embedded thinking guidance throughout
- Document keying compliance (CWS-STD-002)
- Serves all understanding levels
- Professional formatting and footer

**When to use:**

- Creating new standards (CWS-STD-XXX)
- Writing guides or patterns
- Documenting systems or processes
- Any formal documentation

- Hierarchical navigation structures
- Parent/child/sibling linking
- Status tracking integration
- Quick command reference
- Visual organization (emoji, tables)

**When to use:**

- Creating workspace navigation hubs
- Organizing division documentation
- Building comprehensive entry points

- Full 4-block structure (METADATA â†’ SETUP â†’ BODY â†’ CLOSING)
- Code type specifications (Library, Command, Demo-Test, Service)
- Health scoring integration (Base100)
- Embedded documentation guidance
- Standards-compliant structure

**When to use:**

- Creating new Go executables (entry points, CLI tools)
- Creating new Go libraries (reusable packages)
- Creating demonstration-based tests
- Creating project-level Makefiles

## ğŸ¯ Quick Start

### New to Templates?

**1. Identify your need:**

| Need | Use This Template |
|------|------------------|
| Creating a standard, guide, or pattern | [TEMPLATE-G-001](general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md) |
| Creating root-level navigation | [TEMPLATE-T-000](index/TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md) |
| Creating folder/division navigation | [TEMPLATE-T-001](index/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md) |
| Creating a Go executable (CLI, entry point) | [CODE-GO-001](code/go/CODE-GO-001-GO-executable.go) |
| Creating a Go library package | [CODE-GO-002](code/go/CODE-GO-002-GO-library.go) |
| Creating a Go demo-test file | [CODE-GO-003](code/go/CODE-GO-003-GO-demo-test.go) |
| Creating a project-level Makefile | [CODE-MAKE-001](code/make/CODE-MAKE-001-MAKE-project-makefile.mk) |
| Creating a project-level CMakeLists.txt | [CODE-CMAKE-001](code/cmake/CODE-CMAKE-001-CMAKE-project-cmakelists.cmake) |

**2. Copy template to target location:**

```bash
# ğŸ“„ Example: Creating a new standard
cp templates/general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-STD-005-DOC-my-standard.md
```

**3. Follow the template:**

- Read ALL thinking guidance comments
- Replace [PLACEHOLDERS] with your content
- Apply document keying (CWS-STD-002)
- Generate TOC if applicable
- Validate against standards

**[â†’ Detailed usage guide](README.md)**

---

## ğŸ“– How to Use Templates

> [!TIP]
> **Read the thinking comments.** They're not clutter - they're embedded wisdom guiding your decisions as you create documentation.

### Step-by-Step Process

**1. Choose the Right Template**

See [Find the Right Template](#-find-the-right-template) below.

**2. Copy to Target Location**

```bash
# ğŸ“„ Copy template to your target location
cp templates/<category>/<template-file> <your-target-location>
```

**3. Read Thinking Guidance**

Don't skip `<!-- THINKING: -->` comments - they guide your decisions:

```markdown
<!-- THINKING: Who is this serving? What understanding levels need this? -->
<!-- THINKING: What's the scope? What IS and ISN'T covered? -->
```

**4. Replace Placeholders**

Replace all `[PLACEHOLDER]` text with actual content.

**5. Apply Document Keying**

Follow [CWS-STD-002](../standards/CWS-STD-002-DOC-document-keying.md):

```bash
DOMAIN-CATEGORY-NUMBER-SUBCATEGORY-name.ext
```

**6. Complete Metadata**

Fill in all metadata fields (Key, Type, Purpose, Status, etc.).

**7. Write Content**

Use thinking guidance to inform your content decisions.

**8. Delete Template Instructions**

Remove instruction block and applied thinking comments.

**9. Generate TOC (if applicable)**

```bash
# ğŸ“‹ Generate table of contents
doctoc your-new-document.md --notitle
```

**10. Validate**

Check:

- [ ] 4-block structure intact
- [ ] Document keying correct
- [ ] All metadata complete
- [ ] Serves all understanding levels
- [ ] Demonstrates Kingdom Technology excellence

**[â†’ Complete guide in README.md](README.md)**

---

## ğŸ” Find the Right Template

### By Use Case

<details>
<summary><b>Creating formal documentation (standards, guides, patterns)</b></summary>

**Use:** [TEMPLATE-G-001](general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md)

**Examples:**

- New standards (CWS-STD-XXX)
- Implementation guides
- Pattern documentation
- Reference documentation
- Policy documents

**Quick start:**

```bash
cp templates/general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-STD-005-DOC-new-standard.md
```

</details>

<details>
<summary><b>Creating workspace or major division navigation</b></summary>

**Use:** [TEMPLATE-T-000](index/TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md)

**Examples:**

- Root INDEX.md
- Major division navigation
- Comprehensive documentation hub
- Multi-category entry points

**Quick start:**

```bash
cp templates/index/TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md \
   new-area/INDEX.md
```

</details>

<details>
<summary><b>Creating folder or category navigation</b></summary>

**Use:** [TEMPLATE-T-001](index/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md)

**Examples:**

- Division INDEX.md (divisions/tech/, divisions/gaming/)
- Folder navigation (standards/, templates/)
- Category-specific entry points
- Scoped documentation hubs

**Quick start:**

```bash
cp templates/index/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md \
   divisions/new-division/INDEX.md
```

</details>

<details>
<summary><b>Domain-specific documentation needs</b></summary>

**Currently:** Check if [TEMPLATE-G-001](general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md) works first.

**Future:** Specialized templates as needs emerge.

**See:** [Specialized Templates Index](specialized/TEMPLATE-S-000-INDEX-specialized.md) for planned templates.

</details>

### By Template Type

| Template | Category | Status | Primary Use |
|----------|----------|:------:|-------------|
| **[TEMPLATE-G-001](general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md)** | General | âœ… Active | Any formal documentation |
| **[TEMPLATE-T-000](index/TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md)** | INDEX | âœ… Active | Root-level navigation |
| **[TEMPLATE-T-001](index/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md)** | INDEX | âœ… Active | Category navigation |
| **[CODE-GO-001](code/go/CODE-GO-001-GO-executable.go)** | Code | âœ… Active | Go executables (`package main`) |
| **[CODE-GO-002](code/go/CODE-GO-002-GO-library.go)** | Code | âœ… Active | Go library packages |
| **[CODE-GO-003](code/go/CODE-GO-003-GO-demo-test.go)** | Code | âœ… Active | Go demo-test files |
| **[CODE-MAKE-001](code/make/CODE-MAKE-001-MAKE-project-makefile.mk)** | Code | âœ… Active | Project-level Makefiles |
| **[CODE-CMAKE-001](code/cmake/CODE-CMAKE-001-CMAKE-project-cmakelists.cmake)** | Code | âœ… Active | Project-level CMakeLists.txt |
| *Specialized templates* | Specialized | ğŸŸ¡ Planned | Domain-specific needs |

## âš¡ Examples

### Example 1: Creating a New Standard

**Scenario:** Document file system organization standard.

```bash
# 1. ğŸ“„ Copy general template
cp templates/general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-STD-004-DOC-file-system.md

# 2. âœï¸ Edit file:
#    - Key: CWS-STD-004
#    - Type: Standard
#    - Purpose: File system organization for Kingdom Technology
#    - Replace all [PLACEHOLDERS]
#    - Apply thinking guidance

# 3. ğŸ“‹ Generate TOC
doctoc standards/CWS-STD-004-DOC-file-system.md --notitle

# 4. âœ… Validate against Kingdom Technology standards
```

**Result:** Professional standard document following all patterns.

---

### Example 2: Creating Division Navigation

**Scenario:** New education division needs INDEX.md.

```bash
# 1. ğŸ“š Copy category INDEX template
cp templates/index/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md \
   divisions/education/INDEX.md

# 2. âœï¸ Customize:
#    - Title: "Education Division"
#    - Parent link: ../README.md
#    - List child documentation
#    - Add education-specific quick commands

# 3. ğŸ“‹ Generate TOC
doctoc divisions/education/INDEX.md --notitle

# 4. ğŸ”— Link from parent
#    Edit root INDEX.md to include divisions/education/INDEX.md
```

**Result:** Integrated navigation for new division.

---

### Example 3: Creating a Guide

**Scenario:** Write guide on applying documentation standards.

```bash
# 1. ğŸ“„ Copy general template
cp templates/general/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-GUIDE-applying-docs.md

# 2. âœï¸ Fill in:
#    - Key: CWS-GUIDE-001
#    - Type: Guide
#    - Purpose: Practical guide to applying CWS documentation standards
#    - Write step-by-step examples
#    - Include all four understanding levels

# 3. ğŸ“‹ Generate TOC and validate
```

**Result:** Comprehensive guide serving all users.

## ğŸ”§ Template Standards

All templates follow Kingdom Technology standards:

### Core Standards

| Standard | Reference | How Templates Enforce |
|----------|-----------|----------------------|
| **4-Block Structure** | [CWS-STD-001](../standards/CWS-STD-001-DOC-4-block.md) | METADATA â†’ SETUP â†’ BODY â†’ CLOSING built into every template |
| **Document Keying** | [CWS-STD-002](../standards/CWS-STD-002-DOC-document-keying.md) | Placeholders guide proper keying format |
| **Documentation Standards** | [CWS-STD-003](../standards/CWS-STD-003-DOC-documentation-standards.md) | Structure serves all four understanding levels |

### Template Principles

**What makes Kingdom Technology templates different:**

| Principle | Implementation | Why It Matters |
|-----------|----------------|----------------|
| **Thinking guidance** | `<!-- THINKING: -->` comments | Guides decisions, not just structure |
| **Standards compliance** | Built-in patterns from CWS-STD-001/002/003 | Compliance by design |
| **Serving all levels** | Structure accommodates starting â†’ advanced | Nobody blocked by understanding level |
| **Intentional design** | 4-block structure forces clarity | Prevents thoughtless documentation |
| **Kingdom Technology** | The Three Questions embedded | Excellence honoring God |

---

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

### Adding New Templates

**Before creating new template:**

1. **Try existing templates first** - TEMPLATE-G-001 handles most needs
2. **Identify multiple use cases** - Need 3+ scenarios
3. **Document why specialized** - Why general template insufficient
4. **Propose to maintainers** - Nova Dawn or Seanje review

### Improving Existing Templates

**Process for template improvements:**

1. **Use the template** - Real usage reveals improvements
2. **Document issues** - What's unclear or missing?
3. **Propose specific changes** - Not just "make it better"
4. **Test improvement** - Does it actually help?
5. **Submit to maintainers** - For review and integration

### Template Proposal Format

```markdown
## Proposed Template: TEMPLATE-X-###

**Category:** [General/INDEX/Specialized]
**Use cases:** [3+ specific scenarios]
**Why needed:** [Why existing templates insufficient]
**Unique requirements:** [What makes this different]
**Structure outline:** [Proposed sections]
**Examples:** [Real docs this would help create]
**Standards compliance:** [How it follows CWS-STD-001/002/003]
```

### Quick Commands

**View all templates:**

```bash
# ğŸ” Find all template files
find templates/ -name "TEMPLATE-*.md" -type f | sort
```

**View template category:**

```bash
# ğŸ“‚ List templates by category
ls -la templates/general/
ls -la templates/index/
ls -la templates/specialized/
```

**Copy template:**

```bash
# ğŸ“„ Copy template to target location
cp templates/<category>/<template-file> <your-location>
```

**Generate TOC:**

```bash
# ğŸ“‹ Generate table of contents
doctoc <file>.md --notitle
```

**Validate line endings:**

```bash
# âœ… Check Unix line endings
file <file>.md  # Should show "with LF line terminators"
```

## ğŸ“– Biblical Foundation

> "And let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them. According to all that I shew thee, after **the pattern** of the tabernacle, and **the pattern** of all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make it."
>
> **â€” Exodus 25:8-9 (KJV)**

God gave Moses patterns for the tabernacle - not just instructions, but structured thinking. These templates follow that principle: providing patterns that guide intentional design.

Templates aren't about control - they're about **serving others through clarity**. Just as the tabernacle pattern honored God by enabling excellent craftsmanship, these templates honor God by enabling excellent documentation.

**The Three Questions apply to templates:**

1. **Does this honor God?** - By enabling excellence in documentation
2. **Does this serve others?** - By providing clarity and thinking guidance
3. **Does this have eternal value?** - By teaching principles, not just format
